pull_request.title: Adding armv8 crypto extensions to SHA256/224
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
This PR adds the armv8 crypto extensions accelerated implementation of sha256 hashblocks from supercop. This was tested on a ROCK64, a RASPI 3B+, and on an Intel mac (to ensure I didn't break x86 builds by mistake).

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.) - **NO**
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.) - **NO**

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Fixes necessary to compile on raspberry pi 4 with clang
pull_request.body:
The changes in this PR where needed to compile on a raspbery pi 4 using clang.
I do not know if they are portable or correct, but they made the project compile on rpi4 and my x86_64 laptop!

The changes from `size_t` -> `uint64_t` where applied because of narrowed integers.

    $ clang -v
    clang version 7.0.1-8+rpi3+deb10u2 (tags/RELEASE_701/final)
    Target: armv6k-unknown-linux-gnueabihf
    Thread model: posix
    InstalledDir: /usr/bin
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9.4
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7.3.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/8
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9.4
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7.3.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/8
    Selected GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/8
    Candidate multilib: .;@m32
    Selected multilib: .;@m32

The `-Wno-language-extension-token` option was necessary because of the following warnings-turned-error:

    In file included from /home/karo/liboqs/tests/test_aes.c:13:
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 0\t\n" ::"r"(value));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:167:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 1\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:170:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 3\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 0\t\n" ::"r"(value));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:167:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 1\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:170:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 3\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    In file included from /home/karo/liboqs/tests/speed_sig.c:14:
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 0\t\n" ::"r"(value));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:167:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 1\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:170:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 3\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^

pull_request.title: Adding armv8 crypto extensions to SHA256/224
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
This PR adds the armv8 crypto extensions accelerated implementation of sha256 hashblocks from supercop. This was tested on a ROCK64, a RASPI 3B+, and on an Intel mac (to ensure I didn't break x86 builds by mistake).

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.) - **NO**
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.) - **NO**

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

pull_request.title: default groups fix
pull_request.body: Fixes #323 : Enable OQS_DEFAULT_GROUPS only in TLS1.3. Add comment to readme pertaining to classic algs required for all tests to pass.

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes prototype quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs
